first_reading.title: Book of Exodus
first_reading.text:
[[Ex 1,8]]A new king, who knew nothing of Joseph, came to power in Egypt.
[[Ex 1,9]]He said to his subjects, "Look how numerous and powerful the Israelite people are growing, more so than we ourselves!
[[Ex 1,10]]Come, let us deal shrewdly with them to stop their increase; otherwise, in time of war they too may join our enemies to fight against us, and so leave our country."
[[Ex 1,11]]Accordingly, taskmasters were set over the Israelites to oppress them with forced labor. Thus they had to build for Pharaoh the supply cities of Pithom and Raamses.
[[Ex 1,12]]Yet the more they were oppressed, the more they multiplied and spread. The Egyptians, then, dreaded the Israelites
[[Ex 1,13]]and reduced them to cruel slavery,
[[Ex 1,14]]making life bitter for them with hard work in mortar and brick and all kinds of field work--the whole cruel fate of slaves.
[[Ex 1,22]]Pharaoh then commanded all his subjects, "Throw into the river every boy that is born to the Hebrews, but you may let all the girls live."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 124,1]]Had not the LORD been with us– 
let Israel say, had not the LORD been with us–
[[Ps 124,2]]When men rose up against us,
[[Ps 124,3]]then would they have swallowed us alive, 
When their fury was inflamed against us.  

[[Ps 124,4]]Then would the waters have overwhelmed us; 
The torrent would have swept over us;
[[Ps 124,5]]over us then would have swept the raging waters.
[[Ps 124,6]]Blessed be the LORD, who did not leave us 
a prey to their teeth.  

[[Ps 124,7]]We were rescued like a bird 
from the fowlers’ snare; 
Broken was the snare, 
and we were freed.
[[Ps 124,8]]Our help is in the name of the LORD, 
who made heaven and earth.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 10,34]]Jesus said to his Apostles: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace upon the earth. I have come to bring not peace but the sword.
[[Mt 10,35]]For I have come to set a man 'against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;
[[Mt 10,36]]and one's enemies will be those of his household.'
[[Mt 10,37]]Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me;
[[Mt 10,38]]and whoever does not take up his cross and follow after me is not worthy of me.
[[Mt 10,39]]Whoever finds his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.
[[Mt 10,40]]Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives the one who sent me.
[[Mt 10,41]]Whoever receives a prophet because he is a prophet will receive a prophet's reward, and whoever receives a righteous man because he is righteous will receive a righteous man's reward.
[[Mt 10,42]]And whoever gives only a cup of cold water to one of these little ones to drink because he is a disciple--amen, I say to you, he will surely not lose his reward."
[[Mt 11,1]]When Jesus finished giving these commands to his twelve disciples, he went away from that place to teach and to preach in their towns.
